Name: Escalator Cocktail
Ingredients: 5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Review: This orchard-fresh concoction was originally made with Korte Palinka (Hungarian pear schnapps).
History: Created in 2002 by Kevin Connelly, England. It's called an escalator because the 'apples and pears', rhyming slang for 'stairs', are shaken.
Nutrition: One serving of Escalator Cocktail contains 168 calories
